sentences.sContent: She’ll do anything to achieve her own ends.
sentences.sCn: 她为了实现自己的目标，什么都会去做。

sentences.sContent: Every task has a clear end in view.
sentences.sCn: 每一项任务都要有明确的目标。

sentences.sContent: ...the more affluent children end up in college and on the way to the middle class...

...The state’s facilities management project team is still in the process of developing its business justification and expects to have that completed and available to the public at the end of February...

...Morgan said last week that he would retire at the end of January because of the governor’s proposal to split off six universities of the Board of Regents system and create separate governing boards for each of them...
...It’s no wonder that device we buy has a plug on the end of it or a wireless connection to internet soon...
...This is even more important because at the end of this year...
...and we will end up with unprecedented alienation...
...What point does the man make at the end of the conversation...
...We must end the rent-seeking society we have gravitated toward...

synos.tran: 结束；目标；尽头；末端；死亡

phrases.pCn: 到……结束时；到……时为止；在……之前

words.tran: 无止境的；连续的；环状的；漫无目的的
直立着的；向前的；末端朝前或向上的（等于endways）
竖着；末端向前地；两端首尾相接；向着两端（等于endways）

trans.tranOther: an aim or purpose, or the result you hope to achieve
